channel.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
channel.description:
Edit: PROBLEM IS RESOLVED! THANK YOU EVERYONE FOR HELPING. No one really did, but lol I fixed the problem. Turns out there was a number of services, but anyways.... Please don't bother posting, I'm done with this. Had to repeat myself 3 times, the issue has been solved. Thanks.
Note: My ISP wasn't doing scans. It was a virus. I'm not hacking don't worry, even though I really wanted to lol. I called my ISP and they didn't do anything.
Hey. How do I fuck over a hacker?
This hacker, who's IP is 70.27.220.34, keeps 'trying' to hack my fucking computer. He's not getting in, but he's tried 3 times and is annoying the hell out of me.
I really want to piss him off. Can someone show me how to DDOS or Hack into his computer and delete his fucking hardrive. I HATE HACKERS. I wanna just punch him right in the face and knock his nerdy glasses off his ugly face.
Please dont give me a link to "just fucking google it", because I've been to enough hack sites where I automatically get pinged 20 times a second or get a virus or whatever.
~Ron

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

Exactly why I didn’t hack. No matter how much I want to… still.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

[quote=“xerozcheez, post:16, topic:3216”][quote author=Pwnd link=topic=3735.msg36413#msg36413 date=1148411442]
Call your ISP. They’ll contact his.
[/quote]

Best idea here, this’ll be fast and all the other ideas will just get you in trouble and you’ll be as bad as the hacker.[/quote]
The other plus side to this is that, if the offence is great enough, you may get some money in damages

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @itendsnow itendsnow
item.description:
@itendsnow wrote:

Well once again, I’m pretty sure your not equipped well enough and have left it too long to do anything yourself. And like I said, are you sure this some ‘hacker’ or just an ISP doing scans?

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

[quote=“itendsnow, post:21, topic:3216”]Just update your computer, maintain good password practice and have a decent fucking firewall…“Can someone show me how to DDOS or Hack into his computer and delete his fucking hardrive. I HATE HACKERS.” ROFL.

jme_009 is right, as with every new technology new methods to bypass them will arise. Ron, just contact your ISP, anyone on here who gives you links to a “leet site” probably know about as much as you, nothing and nothing people post her will show you how to DDOS or Hack his computer, and tbh if he really is a hacker he’ll have decent enough measure to bounce any attempts by some random net user who just downloaded some software to dos him.

Also check whether or not this is actually a hack, what my firewall told me once was a hack turned out to be BT (British Telecom) doing random scans it seems.[/quote]

omg lol ONCE AGAIN. I contacted my ISP and they did nothing.

Just read my previous post.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @itendsnow itendsnow
item.description:
@itendsnow wrote:

Just update your computer, maintain good password practice and have a decent fucking firewall…“Can someone show me how to DDOS or Hack into his computer and delete his fucking hardrive. I HATE HACKERS.” ROFL.

jme_009 is right, as with every new technology new methods to bypass them will arise. Ron, just contact your ISP, anyone on here who gives you links to a “leet site” probably know about as much as you, nothing and nothing people post her will show you how to DDOS or Hack his computer, and tbh if he really is a hacker he’ll have decent enough measure to bounce any attempts by some random net user who just downloaded some software to dos him.

Also check whether or not this is actually a hack, what my firewall told me once was a hack turned out to be BT (British Telecom) doing random scans it seems.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @_1one_eleven1 !!1one!eleven1!
item.description:
@_1one_eleven1 wrote:

Contacting your isp is not an over night thing… or in your case a 5 hour thing

it may take days/weeks.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

The one sent to me was a virus. Virus name was: MS Windows H.323 BO(2)

Like I said before, contacting my ISP didn’t do shit. But I found out that when I open BitTorrent, someone is looking at all the IP addresses connected to them, and is using the program to obtain people’s IPs and then hacking them or at least trying to, through BitTorrent.

What I did was completely disable TCP incomming, I think. I disabled a lot of shares on my computer and a bunch of services from services.msc that contributed.

Now even if the guy gets through using TCP, it will bounce off the computer. Yay.

~Ron

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @_1one_eleven1 !!1one!eleven1!
item.description:
@_1one_eleven1 wrote:

Not all intrusions are hacks, when i used zone alarm i had google bot appear as a high alert, web crawlers etc are sometimes on high. Also that guy might just be port scanning or something, let him be, if you have a good firewall theres nothing to worry about. Email your ISP, let them take care of it.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

I can't wait until web 2.0 comes out and we get some very secure protocols, so secure, hacking would be 'nearly' and/or supposedly impossible.

Correction, Hacking will just get more advanced

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues

item.description:
@xerozcheez wrote:

Pwnd:

Call your ISP. They’ll contact his.

Best idea here, this’ll be fast and all the other ideas will just get you in trouble and you’ll be as bad as the hacker.

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

rabcarl:

www.splintersecurity.com… it’s where i’ve been going for awhile and its a leet site

Thank you.

weaselforce:

I like how you hate hackers, but want to hack someone.

Fuck you. I gues you liked getting attacked. Jack off…

hellothere:

If this “hacker” is any good i’d be impressed if you can find the second or third proxy down the chain he was using. His ISP? rofl good luck.

You’re right. The ISP didn’t do anything about it. Ugh… If they did , they woudl be getting millions of calls a day lol. Or at elast 1000s.

[quote=“jme_009, post:11, topic:3216”]If he is using a proxy, you try contacting the owner of the proxy If he’s nice, maybe he’ll point you in the right direction.

Either way, why are you getting attacked? Get zone alarm, or sygate or something… Maybe you have a trojan on your computer? Try scanning your computer and all that stuff…[/quote]
Ihave 3 firewalls like I mentioned above… including a software firewall. Though you still get “attacked”, that’s the purpose of the firewall, to block attacks lol.

The reason I’m getting attacked is that some moron who wants to get credit card information is trying to get into other people’s computers. That’s 99% of the reason anyone gets hacked nowdays. I can’t wait until web 2.0 comes out and we get some very secure protocols, so secure, hacking would be ‘nearly’ and/or supposedly impossible.

I was hoping there was a hacker on this forum, who could just bother the guy that hacked me, but I geuss not lol. Oh well, He’s gone now. It just bothered me that he got through 2/3 firewalls.

No keyloggers/viruses were installed on my computer, except for when I downloaded a hack like an idiot. I shouldn’t have lol, wasn’t smart.

Thanks for all your help.

~Ron[br][size=1]Posted at: May 23, 2006, 06:18:33 pm[/size][hr]fuck… just got attacked again.

Intrusion: MS Windows H.323 BO(2)
Intruder: YOUR-3496B456F8(192.168.1.47)(1875)
Risk Level: High
Protocol: TCP
Attacked IP: 70.27.220.34
Attacked Port: 1720

GRRRR!!! [br][size=1]Posted at: May 23, 2006, 06:23:44 pm[/size][hr]It’s a guy hacking people downloading torrents. I just found out when I googled the Virus.

Watch out if anyone downloads torrents…

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @hellothere hellothere
item.description:
@hellothere wrote:

jme_009:

If he is using a proxy, you try contacting the owner of the proxy If he’s nice, maybe he’ll point you in the right direction.

Yeah, 90% of the proxy owners either dont give a hell, or dont keep logs. And the ones that do you wont get a hold of them in less than two weeks. Never seen anyone get caught who was using a proxy chain. So yeah, you can try talking to some dude in canada, who will direct you to an ip in Romania who most likely wont speak english. And after you’ve wasted your life for a couple of days you can go cut yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: [SOLVED] Hacker issues
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

If he is using a proxy, you try contacting the owner of the proxy If he’s nice, maybe he’ll point you in the right direction.

Either way, why are you getting attacked? Get zone alarm, or sygate or something… Maybe you have a trojan on your computer? Try scanning your computer and all that stuff…

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Ron Ron
item.description:
@Ron wrote:

I wish I had friends that are hackers lol. Like a team of hackers who all just make his computer melt down. That would be so sweet, since I get 10 attacks a day. =\

Used to be 50 a day until we got a router firewall. Then dropped down to 25 a day, and then we installed a hardware firewall and now only 10 a day get passed. lol

~Ron

Read full topic

Thanks Chris.

By the way, he’s a Canadian Motherfucker. In Otawa, Ontario.

But you’re right. He could be using a proxy… or could have hacked someone and be using their computer as a zombie to hack others.
